data.description: A perl interface into Windows Perf Monitor
data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
I've used Win32::PerfLib a number of times, but I've found it hard
    to use, and there have been things that I've been unable to do with
    it. I've found getting a single counters value very long winded, and
    it's not possible to get a counters explain string from the OS etc
    ......

    Win32::Perflib is good, don't get me wrong, I just feel that I can
    improve on it, and rather than extending the existing module which
    some people may be very happy using, I'd rather introduce another
    version, which will give people another option.
